courseTitle: Foundations of Sports Medicine for Health Care Providers
courseDescription: An overview of tissue response to injury and pain transmission provide the foundation from which students will learn about physical agents and specific conditions from a medical perspective. Pathology for specific injuries will be taught, and students will become familiar with the theoretical and practical application of physical agents as it relates to tissue response to injury and pain control. An introduction to the basic principles and underlying theories relating to examination and treatment techniques will also be presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of physical agents for pain control
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients regarding injuries
Collaboration with healthcare team for treatment plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing specific conditions for appropriate treatment strategies

courseTitle: Clinical Examination and Patient Care-Spine & Head
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide information relative to the prevention, recognition, evaluation, treatment, rehabilitation, and return to function and/or activity of athletic injuries involving the spine or head.
Technical and Digital Skills: Spine and head injury evaluation techniques
Clinical assessment tools for head injuries
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients regarding treatment plans
Interacting with interdisciplinary healthcare teams for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting diagnostic imaging results for spine and head injuries
Developing individualized treatment plans based on assessment findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading rehabilitation sessions for spinal injury patients

courseTitle: Clinical Examination and Patient Care-Lower Extremity
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide information relative to the prevention, recognition, evaluation, treatment, rehabilitation, and return to function and/or activity of athletic injuries involving the lower extremity.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with healthcare team members
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Differential diagnosis of lower extremity injuries
Treatment planning based on evaluation findings

courseTitle: Clinical Examination and Patient Care-Upper Extremity
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide information relative to the prevention, recognition, evaluation, treatment, rehabilitation, and return to function and/or activity of athletic injuries involving the upper extremity.
Technical and Digital Skills: Diagnostic imaging interpretation for upper extremity injuries
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with healthcare team members for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing treatment plans based on evaluation findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading rehabilitation programs for upper extremity injuries

courseTitle: Management of Medical Conditions for Healthcare Providers I
courseDescription: Instruction and practice in advanced first aid, Emergency Cardiac Care techniques, and oxygen administration for the paramedical professional. A study of the knowledge and skills required to recognize, triage, refer, and treat, as appropriate, internal injuries, general medical conditions, and disabilities of patients involved in physical activity.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Triage of patients with medical conditions
Treatment decision-making for physical activity-related issues

courseDescription: This course is designed to cover the anatomical and mechanical analysis of human musculoskeletal function. Principles of biomechanics, connective tissue behavior, and muscle physiology are integrated with joint structure and function to form the basis of understanding normal and pathological movement.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of movement analysis findings
Collaboration with other healthcare providers for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing treatment plans based on movement analysis
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading interdisciplinary teams in movement assessment
Implementing treatment protocols for musculoskeletal issues

courseDescription: This course is designed to introduce the graduate student to research processes in the athletic training field. The focus is on understanding and recognizing principles of evidence-based practice in athletic training, understanding the elements of evidence, appraising the evidence, and considering the evidence for use in clinical practice.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding research processes in the athletic training field
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with peers on research projects

courseDescription: Designed to provide an understanding of evidence-based practice to the sports medicine setting and the intricacies of performing evidence-based practice research projects.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data collection techniques in sports medicine research
Statistical analysis in sports science research
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Networking with other professionals in the field

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Implementing evidence-based practice in treatment plans
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and coaches
Collaborating with other healthcare professionals in the sports setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing customized treatment strategies based on evidence
Troubleshooting equipment issues in the athletic training setting
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and supervising student athletic trainers
Coordinating with sports teams for injury prevention programs

courseDescription: This course is designed to systematically guide professional athletic training students through the research process. Coursework will focus on development of an original research idea, building the theoretical background, and identifying the rationale for a research project. Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor outside of the time permitted for class.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to work independently with research supervisor

courseDescription: This course is designed for sports medicine clinicians and will focus on advanced topics in the study of orthopaedic evaluation, assessment, management, and rehabilitation of common athletic injuries.  A combination of discussion, lecture, critical review of literature, laboratory activities, and student presentations will be employed throughout the course.
Technical and Digital Skills: Utilization of advanced medical equipment in evaluation
Data analysis of injury trends in sports medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and coaches
Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams in treatment planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research literature in orthopaedics
Designing customized rehabilitation plans based on injury severity and athlete's needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing multiple cases concurrently in a clinical setting

courseDescription: A course designed to provide information relative to the recognition, evaluation, and treatment of athletic injuries involving the spine.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with healthcare professionals in treatment planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis of athletic injuries involving the spine
Developing customized rehabilitation plans for spinal injuries
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a multidisciplinary team in the treatment of spinal injuries
Organizing and prioritizing treatment plans for athletes with spinal injuries

courseDescription: This clinical experience entails interaction with healthcare providers associated with sports medicine specialties and general medical concerns.
This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Hands-on experience in athletic training settings
Utilizing evidence-based practice in sports medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with athletes and coaching staff
Effective communication with patients and healthcare professionals
Providing clear instructions for exercises and treatments
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing individualized treatment plans based on evidence and patient needs
Analyzing research studies in sports medicine

courseDescription: This is a course designed to guide professional athletic training students through aspects of the research process. Coursework will focus on writing the Methods sections for a research manuscript, writing the results section for a research manuscript and proper data entry techniques for a research project. Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor and collect data for their respective project outside of the time permitted for class.

courseTitle: Documentation & Quality Improvement for Healthcare Providers
courseDescription: This course will provide an overview of medical terminology, and best practices in medical documentation will be emphasized.  Use of documentation strategies to analyze practice trends to identify and implement quality improvement strategies will be stressed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Practice trend analysis using software tools
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with healthcare team members
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Implementing data-driven strategies for quality enhancement
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementing documentation best practices across the healthcare facility

courseTitle: Clinical Medicine for Healthcare Providers I
courseDescription: This course introduces the healthcare student to the normal and abnormal physiology of different body systems as well as differential diagnoses in common medical conditions. Factors associated with those body systems that influence examination and intervention will be discussed. Also discussed is when referral to other practitioners is recommended and required.  A case study approach is employed to enforce critical thinking and to mimic practical application.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding normal and abnormal physiology of different body systems
Performing differential diagnoses in common medical conditions
Knowledge of factors influencing examination and intervention in body systems
Utilizing case study approach for critical thinking
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and colleagues
Referral to other practitioners when necessary
Collaborating with healthcare team members for patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Implementing practical application of medical knowledge
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with other healthcare providers for comprehensive care

courseTitle: Clinical Medicine for Healthcare Providers II
courseDescription: This course will address health across the lifespan, as well as highlight strategies to mitigate the risk of long-term health complications. This course will additionally identify and describe various modes of imaging techniques and tests used in medical practice for the neurological, musculoskeletal, cardiovascular, and pulmonary systems.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of imaging techniques in medical practice
Knowledge of tests for neurological, musculoskeletal, cardiovascular, and pulmonary systems
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective patient communication regarding imaging procedures
Collaboration with healthcare team for patient care plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and interpreting complex medical imaging results
Identifying potential health complications based on imaging findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing patient imaging schedules and prioritizing urgent cases
Leading interdisciplinary discussions on imaging findings for treatment planning

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Evidence-based practice implementation in sports medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and coaches
Team collaboration in a clinical setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing treatment plans based on evidence-based research
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing multiple cases efficiently in a clinical setting

courseDescription: This course is designed to guide professional athletic training students through aspects of the research process. Coursework will focus on writing the discussion section for a research manuscript, writing a research abstract for submission to a conference, developing an oral research presentation for a conference, and creating a poster presentation for a conference. Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor outside of the time permitted for class.
This clinical experience entails interactions with healthcare providers associated with orthopedic specialties and general medical concerns.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Clinical leadership in orthopedic and general medical contexts

courseDescription: This clinical experience entails interaction with healthcare providers associated with sports medicine specialties and general medical concerns.

courseTitle: Integration of Evidence for Clinical Decision Making in Sports Medicine
courseDescription: This course is designed to introduce the graduate student to research processes in the athletic training field.   The focus is on understanding and recognizing principles of EBP in athletic training, understanding the elements of evidence, appraising the evidence, and considering the evidence for use in clinical practice.
Technical and Digital Skills: Clinical decision making in sports medicine

courseTitle: Statistical Techniques for Clinical Decision Making in Sports Medicine
courseDescription: This course includes conceptual and computational applications associated with the common statistical techniques relevant to sports medicine clinicians.  The intent is to provide students with an introduction to frequently used descriptive and inferential statistical methods for clinical or research purposes in sports medicine.  Lectures and laboratory exercises will be utilized to instruct students on using statistics to be intelligent consumers of the research literature.  Emphasis will be placed on using statistics to make informed, evidence-based clinical decisions with the goal of enhancing patient care.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data visualization techniques for clinical data
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting statistical findings to non-technical audiences
Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams in sports medicine
Effective communication of statistical results in patient care contexts
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of statistical methods in research literature
Identifying and addressing statistical biases in clinical decision making
Statistical hypothesis testing for evidence-based practice
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading statistical analysis projects in sports medicine
Prioritizing statistical tasks for patient care improvement
Managing data collection processes for statistical analysis in clinical settings

courseDescription: Introduces principles of drug therapy across the lifespan and their use pertaining to the healthcare of the physically active.  An emphasis on the application of knowledge and skills required of the healthcare provider, including indications, contraindications, precautions, interactions, documentation, and governing regulations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of indications and contraindications of drugs
Documentation skills related to drug therapy
Compliance with governing regulations in drug therapy
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients regarding drug therapy
Collaboration with healthcare providers for optimal patient care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing drug interactions and potential precautions
Critical evaluation of drug therapy options for different patient scenarios
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing drug therapy protocols for multiple patients
Providing leadership in implementing effective drug therapy practices

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Hands-on experience in athletic training settings
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and coaching staff
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying root causes of athletic injuries
Developing customized treatment plans based on evidence
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team of athletic trainers
Prioritizing tasks based on urgency and severity of injuries

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide information related to teaching strategies and techniques along with supervised and mentored teaching experiences within fields applicable to athletic training.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching strategies based on student performance
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with other educators for interdisciplinary projects

courseDescription: Stresses clinical techniques used in the management and assessment of the lower extremity and spine through utilization of evidence-based practice.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification of treatment plans based on assessment findings

courseDescription: The focus of this course is on identification, referral, and coordinated treatment options for patients with mental and behavioral health conditions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Identification of mental and behavioral health conditions

courseDescription: This course will provide in-depth coverage of legal and ethical concerns for sports medicine healthcare providers.  Identification and analysis of applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations that are specific to the delivery of healthcare.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of healthcare laws and regulations
Knowledge of legal and ethical considerations in sports medicine healthcare
Identifying applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations in healthcare delivery
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of legal and ethical concerns in healthcare delivery
Collaboration with healthcare providers to address legal and ethical issues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis of legal and ethical implications in healthcare practices
Problem-solving to ensure compliance with healthcare laws and regulations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in implementing legal and ethical guidelines in healthcare settings
Organizational skills to manage legal and ethical concerns in healthcare delivery

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and medical staff
Team collaboration in a clinical setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Treatment planning and implementation based on evidence
Critical evaluation of medical research in sports medicine

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding evidence-based practice in sports medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with athletic trainers and coaches
Communicating effectively with athletes and coaching staff
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing treatment plans based on evidence-based practice

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research in sports medicine
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Team coordination in a clinical setting

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide practical experience in the athletic training setting and an understanding of evidence-based practice in sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Evidence-based practice implementation in sports medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with athletes and coaches
Collaboration with healthcare professionals in the sports medicine field
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of injury management strategies
Analyzing and interpreting data related to athletic performance and recovery
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and coordinating a team of athletic trainers
Developing and implementing practice protocols in sports medicine

courseDescription: This course is designed to systematically guide post-professional athletic training students through the research process.  Coursework will focus on development of an original research idea, building the theoretical background, and identifying the rationale for a research project.  Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor outside of the time permitted for class.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with peers on research projects
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Taking initiative in research project planning

courseDescription: This is a course designed to guide post-professional athletic training students through aspects of the research process.  Coursework will focus on writing the Methods sections for a research manuscript, writing the results section for a research manuscript and proper data entry techniques for a research project. Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor and collect data for their respective project outside of the time permitted for class.
Technical and Digital Skills: Research manuscript writing (Methods and Results sections)

courseDescription: This course is designed to guide post-professional athletic training students through aspects of the research process.  Coursework will focus on writing the discussion section for a research manuscript, writing a research abstract for submission to a conference, developing an oral research presentation for a conference, and creating a poster presentation for a conference. Based on the nature of this course, students will be required to meet with a research supervisor outside of the time permitted for class.

An overview of administrative and organizational concepts that relate to healthcare entities that provide athletic training services. Facility design, fiscal management, organizational management, and insurance issues will be emphasized.  Students will learn about the development and implementation of policies and procedures that occur within an organization that delivers patient care that can impact delivery and quality of care.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of healthcare policies and procedures
Analyzing impact on patient care delivery and quality

courseDescription: A study of the principles and techniques utilized in optimizing physical performance and reducing injury through proper and effective strength and conditioning programs. Special emphasis will be placed on current research findings, breakthrough and advanced weight training techniques, and popular conditioning practices. This course will also provide the student with skills in exercise leadership. The student will learn how to lead resistance training, flexibility training, cardiovascular training involving a variety of exercise modes, and group exercise.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing research findings related to physical performance optimization and injury reduction
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and executing effective exercise programs

courseDescription: Seminar-based course that will involve discussion of critical questions and contemporary issues and problems in athletic training/sports medicine.
Technical and Digital Skills: Technology integration in sports medicine practices
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Facilitating group discussions on athletic training challenges
Presenting research findings to peers and professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis of current trends in sports medicine
Developing innovative solutions to common athletic injuries
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading discussions on contemporary issues in athletic training
Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams in sports medicine

courseTitle: Professional Competence Assessment in Athletic Training
courseDescription: Knowledge and skills for successful pursuit of athletic training credentials, including Board Of Certification (BOC) examination preparation, employment, and continuing professional competence. Will include self-analysis of patient encounter portfolio and identification of clinical needs.

courseTitle: Gross Anatomy for the Rehabilitation Sciences
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide students in the School of Rehabilitation Sciences an interprofessional education experience that teaches the basic principles and concepts of human gross anatomy so they can apply it to their clinical practice.  While multiple body systems will be covered, emphasis will be on the musculoskeletal, articular, nervous, and vascular systems.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of musculoskeletal, articular, nervous, and vascular systems
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Patient education based on anatomy understanding
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing treatment plans based on anatomical knowledge
Analyzing anatomical data for research purposes
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating interprofessional teams for patient care
Developing educational materials for anatomy instruction

courseDescription: An overview of clinical reasoning strategies and opportunities for clinical practice implementation will be provided.  Students are provided a review of both human anatomy and evidence-based strategies for the delivery of care. Students will learn about the development and implementation of policies and procedures that can impact delivery and quality of care.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and colleagues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and addressing care delivery challenges

courseTitle: Analysis of Human Motion for Sports Medicine Clinicians
courseDescription: This course includes theories and applications of techniques concerning the analysis of human motion for the sports medicine clinician.  The intent of this course is to provide students with an introduction to quantitative analysis of human motion and the concepts and equipment to collect objective quantifiable data for clinical or research purposes.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying patterns in human motion data
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating research activities with team members

courseDescription: Designed to introduce current concepts of curriculum development, evaluation methods, course construction and testing as related to the athletic training clinical and didactic experience.  Designed to introduce the graduate student to aspects of the management of learning and instruction; how learners learn and how teacherscan facilitate their learning as related to the athletictraining didactic and clinical experience.

courseTitle: Analysis of Human Motion for Sports Medicine Clinicians
courseDescription: This course includes theories and applications of techniques concerning the analysis of human motion.  It is designed to provide opportunities for the advanced study of motion analysis techniques for the study of human movement.  The intent of this course is to provide students with an extensive knowledge concerning quantitative analysis of human motion and the concepts and equipment to collect objective quantifiable data to be used for clinical or research purposes.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with research team for data collection
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying patterns in human motion data
Troubleshooting equipment malfunctions during data collection
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team in motion analysis projects

courseDescription: This course is a pass/fail course for master's students in their final semester. It may be taken to fulfill the registration requirement necessary for graduation.  All master's students are required to be registered for at least one graduate credit hour in the semester of their graduation.
